intro: Chrysanthemum leucanthemum var. leucolepis, commonly known as the white marguerite, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, gray-green leaves and white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often used in gardens for its ornamental value. This variety is noted for its compact growth and ability to bloom throughout the summer season.
